summary: The diff implements admin authorization fixes, payment gate blocking, and user management UI for manual payment verification. All three requirements appear to be implemented with backend authorization logic, frontend payment gate component, and admin user list with toggle controls.

hallucinated_features.description: Subscription status and expiration dates functionality including 30-day access grants
hallucinated_features.reason: The Admin.tsx page implements subscription management with 30-day duration grants and expiry date tracking. The BuildRequest explicitly lists 'Subscription duration tracking or expiration dates' as a non-goal. The requirement only asks for simple Paid/Unpaid toggle controls.

hallucinated_features.description: Subscription status badges showing Active/Expired/Pending states with expiry date formatting
hallucinated_features.reason: Admin.tsx implements getStatusBadge() and formatExpiryDate() functions to display subscription expiry information. This contradicts the non-goal of 'Subscription duration tracking or expiration dates'. Only binary Paid/Unpaid status was requested.

hallucinated_features.description: Grant 30-day access and Mark as Expired buttons in admin interface
hallucinated_features.reason: Admin.tsx provides handleGrantAccess() and handleMarkExpired() functions with 30-day duration logic. The BuildRequest only requires toggle controls for Paid/Unpaid status, not time-based subscription management.
